projects.name: katalog
projects.description: A comprehensive Goodreads data scraper and analytics dashboard that automatically tracks reading activity, provides detailed statistics, and visualizes reading habits over time.
projects.purpose: To provide a centralized platform for Goodreads users to analyze their reading patterns and visualize their library data.
projects.technicalities: Built using Python for scraping, TypeScript for the frontend, and integrating with Supabase for data storage and authentication.
projects.other: Features real-time updates and interactive charts using Recharts.

projects.name: nuk-ai
projects.description: A real-time occupancy monitoring and prediction platform that leverages simulated IoT sensor data, machine learning, and conversational AI to provide intelligent insights about space availability at Snell Library, NEU, Boston.
projects.purpose: Aims to modernize library space management by providing students with live updates on seat availability.
projects.technicalities: Utilizes machine learning models for occupancy prediction and a custom-built AI chatbot for natural language queries.
projects.other: Winner of the Hack NUACM ideathon track.

projects.name: The Heritage Lab
projects.description: A digital platform unifying museum curators, curious minds, and casual readers across the world. I helped create custom themes, ACF components, and other custom HTML/CSS/JS modules to help site administrators build creative, engaging, and interactive content via their admin dashboard.
projects.purpose: A digital exhibition space for cultural heritage artifacts and stories.
projects.technicalities: Developed using WordPress with heavily customized themes and Advanced Custom Fields for dynamic content management.
projects.other: Collaborated with international museum curators to design interactive modules.

projects.name: Digital Humanities Project
projects.description: A digital exhibition that explores the proliferation of racism and sexism through a study of popular visual depictions of domestic workers on trade cards and postcards. The built from scratch dashboard serves as a digital archive where anyone can browse through the collection used for this research.
projects.purpose: To document and analyze historical visual media through a digital lens.
projects.technicalities: Includes a searchable digital archive and interactive visualization of trade card metadata.
projects.other: Academic research project in collaboration with Northeastern University humanities department.

projects.name: Debrief
projects.description: An OpenAI powered Google Chrome extension that briefs you about your search results, right on your search results page.
projects.purpose: To streamline information consumption by summarizing search results instantly.
projects.technicalities: Built as a Chrome Extension leveraging the OpenAI API for natural language processing.
projects.other: Optimized for minimal performance impact on browser search speeds.

projects.name: Stock Portfolio Manager
projects.description: A stock portfolio manager built in Java as both a CLI and Swing UI based application. It allows users to build and manage a portfolio of stocks and integrates the AlphaVantage API to pull real stock data.
projects.purpose: A comprehensive tool for managing personal stock investments with real-time data.
projects.technicalities: Implemented using Java Swing for the GUI and integrated with external financial APIs for live market data.
projects.other: Includes detailed portfolio analysis and performance tracking features.

events.name: Hack NUACM
description: At a hackathon conducted by the ACM chapter of Northeastern University, Boston, my team and I emerged as winners in the Ideathon track for the most innovative idea pitched and implemented in 24 hours.

We built a real-time occupancy monitoring and prediction platform that leverages simulated IoT sensor data, machine learning, and conversational AI to provide intelligent insights about space availability at Snell Library, NEU, Boston.

events.name: HackMIT 2025
description: I was a mentor and judge at HackMIT 2025 organized by MIT and having the distinction of being the largest student run hackathon in the USA. It was a full circle moment for me as I had previously participated in this very event during my undergraduate days in 2021.
It was energizing to witness the variety, scale, and innovation of the ideas built by various teams within 24 hours on topics as vast as healthcare, education, environment, and more.
